meanings.definition: A flat-bottomed boat or float used for supporting a bridge or floating structure.
meanings.sent1: The workers placed the pontoon in the river to support the temporary bridge.
meanings.sent2: The pontoon gently floated on the calm lake, carrying the fishermen.
meanings.sent3: The ducks gathered around the pontoon, thinking it was a new type of island.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like pontoons, providing support and stability to the project.
meanings.sent5: The bright red pontoon stood out against the blue water, making it easy to spot.

meanings.definition: A card game similar to blackjack, played with a deck of 52 cards.
meanings.sent1: During the family gathering, they decided to play pontoon with the deck of cards.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends enjoyed a competitive game of pontoon late into the night.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa always wins at pontoon; he must have a lucky charm hidden somewhere!
meanings.sent4: Her strategy in negotiations was like playing pontoon, carefully weighing each move.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room rose as the final round of pontoon began, with everyone hoping to win.
